result.execSummary:
The defendant Keiona Ann Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and mental health treatment
Sign up for probation no later than 10-29-2022

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $2,958.00 made payable to Speedway; pay by the end of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 10-29-2022; pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with any Speedway.

- Mental Health Assessment and comply with recommendations.
- Complete a Cognitive Thinking Class.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keiona Ann Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Keiona Ann Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, Huber Privileges for work and mental health treatment. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/29/2022.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.
- No contact with any Speedway.
- Complete a cognitive thinking class.
- Restitution set at $2,958.00 made payable to Speedway pay by the end of probation. 
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/29/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Court is down and unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case scheduled for 10/27/2022 at 11:00 am for Plea and Setencing Hearing, Courthouse Room 623.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Discussion held off the record.  Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a plea and sentencing date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 623 of the Courthouse.

Parties was originally given 8-3-2022 at 9:30am which was given in error. New date was confirmed with parties via email
Defense to notify his client.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defennse counsel in court to advise the court this case is scheduled at 1:30pm and  has a different matter scheduled in a different court.
Matter heard off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review with client.
Court advised defense counsel his client still need to appear for today's hearing to obtain the next court date. Defense confirms. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/07/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with all Speedways in Milwaukee County.

Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Keiona Ann Brown
Current: 2211 South 16th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: 2211 South 16thst Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/5/22 @ 1:30p
